summary: The document is a declassified record pertaining to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It highlights the appearance of 'REVOLUTION' magazine's combined issues No's 10-11 on Paris newsstands and discusses Richard Gibson's alleged misuse of his position within the 'Fair Play for Cuba Committee' to infiltrate the international revolutionary movement. This led to his disassociation from the magazine. The document also alludes to a secret operation and investigations into Gibson's affiliations.
key_findings: The document was released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It discusses 'REVOLUTION' magazine's issues and its position on Richard Gibson.
Richard Gibson is accused of using his role in the 'Fair Play for Cuba Committee' to infiltrate the international revolutionary movement.
There are mentions of secret operations and inquiries into Gibson's possible affiliations.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
